name: Devastating Twin Dwarfblade (Fighter 12 / Rogue 2 / Dwarven Defender 26)
author: Orion

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Don't you love a good Dwarven Attacker Defender build?

Fighter / Rogue / DD is a very classic and powerful class combination.

This one decides to travel down the two-bladed sword, improved two weapon fighting, devastating critical route.

It ends up with 32 base strength, base AB 45, base 560hp, devastating critical at level 35, WF/EWF/EP, WS/EWS, DR 15/-, 184 skill points for max discipline/listen/spot/search/Tumble 40/UMD 33, evasion.

Switch to one handed / shield and the AB is still useful at 42.

Had a look through the archives and this seems to be different to what is out there.

Fighter 7 / Rogue 3 / DD 30 by Lok-SG
The Anvil by Mithdradates
Concealed Wall by Kail Pendragon
Versatile Wall by Diesel, Vin Diesel
The Citadel by by Grizzled_Dwarflord
The Resistor by Cinnabar Din

Anyway the numbers look good, only big downside I can see is getting evasion and UMD a little late, I do this to maximise BAB and feats in the build. 

If I didn't take devastating critical in this build I would take disarm/improved disarm for the great bonuses with the large weapon + 6-7 APR, and the bonus feats could be epic energy resistances / armor skin.

I think every dwarven fighter and dwarven defender dreams for EDR III, I dont go for it here though, its to protect the AB with the AB penalties from dual wielding, but one could drop strength (by about 6 or by about 4 by dropping dev crit), dex by 1 and int by a bit to get it.

I've posted this one up in the unfinished section for your comments/suggestions/personal tweaks, for some reason to me this looks pretty strong.

Dual kukri has a bigger threat range but is more disarmable and you need to find two good ones.

I think your sword and board number should be 1 lower than your dual weapon, not 3. You lose WF and EWF, retain EWP and gain +2 on dual weapon for the AB cost of dealing.

I like the build, wish it could be done with HOrc :)
